comments.body: I don't think we want this  to show up in the docs we publish do we? There shouldn't be warnings now with the fixes you already introduced but I think it would be better for the end user to not see what are essentially messages they can't do anything about.

This is only information for the developer. Not everyone knows this switch. The end-user will not see these messages because we have a zero error policy in the documentation.  Console warnings continue to appear, so this option is safe.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +220,224 @@
# If true, keep warnings as "system message" paragraphs in the built documents.
keep_warnings = True
